page.title: 20Christmas in Wolverhampton
page.content: Christmas is a time of rejoicing,of asking relatives around. On Christmas Day in 1984 my Nan was with us. I had a lot of lovely presents,a record player, skirt and lots more. Christmas at home is lovely and I feel sorry for people like tramps who haven't any home and countries like Ethiopia where there is a famine and families are dying. The record "Feed the World" has helped them a lot but they need more. I am glad I am not there. We had a Christmas Tree with lights and glittering baubles. There was a really big Christmas Tree with lights on outside St.Peters Church and the nativity scene is there as well. I hope this custom lasts because this helps people to realise that it is Christmas and,if only for a short time,they are kind to each other.
